result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Michael Larson

defendant.name: Larson, Anthony Michael
defendant.address: 1404 S. 10 th Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
9:47 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony Michael Larson not in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Anthony Michael Larson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on the appearance of the defendant. Attorney Zaleski comments that the defendant is ready for a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony Michael Larson appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Anthony Michael Larson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on the status of the case. Offer has been received. Defendant would like to get a second opinion. Requests the court to allow Attorney Zaleski to withdraw. 
Defendant comments. 
Court addresses the defendant. 
Defendant comments. 
Court will allow a continuance so defendant may seek a second opinion.  At the next hearing the court will revisit the withdraw request.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:34 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony Michael Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Anthony Michael Larson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on the status of the case.
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jury status hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony Michael Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Anthony Michael Larson. 

Atty Zaleski is heard waives reading of the criminal complaint/information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:32 PM Case called - appearances stated. Defendant Anthony Michael Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court advises that def. does qualify for Public def., but no attorney was available today.
Court will continue this matter for attorney to be appointed
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
The State Public Defender's Office indicates that Mr. Larson does qualify for a public defender but they will not have one for him by his court date of 6/28 @ 3:30 PM.

2:14 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony Michael Larson in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:08 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony M Larson in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a signature bond. Defendant shall have no contact with CSP. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders no additional cash bond, as defendant already posted $150.00 cash. Defendant shall have no contact with CSP. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant shall have no contact with CSP.
